name: Bunny Wailer
description: '''Neville O'Riley Livingston''' {{Post-nominals|country=JAM|size=100%|OM|OJ}} (10 April 1947 â€“ 2 March 2021), known professionally as '''Bunny Wailer''', was a [[Jamaicans|Jamaican]] singer-songwriter and [[Percussion instrument|percussionist]]. He was an original member of [[reggae]] group [[Bob Marley and the Wailers|The Wailers]] along with [[Bob Marley]] and [[Peter Tosh]]. A three-time [[Grammy Award]] winner, he is considered one of the longtime standard-bearers of reggae music. He was also known as '''Jah B''', '''Bunny O'Riley''', and '''Bunny Livingston'''.
